translation.title: The Interior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times

next.name: The Exterior and What’s Impermanent in the Three Times

previous.name: The Interior and What’s Suffering in the Three Times

segments.en: 210–212. The Interior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times
“Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not-self.

segments.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ … pe …
segments.en: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

segments.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
